official-title.#text: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish fair and consistent eligibility requirements for graduate medical schools operating outside the United States and Canada.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Foreign Medical School Accountability Fairness Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to establish consistent eligibility requirements for graduate medical schools operating outside of the United States and Canada in order to increase accountability and protect American students and taxpayer dollars.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 102(a)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965

text.#text: in the case of a graduate medical school located outside the United States—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in the year preceding the year for which a student is seeking a loan under

text.#text: at least 60 percent of those enrolled in, and at least 60 percent of the graduates of, the graduate medical school outside the United States were not persons described in

at least 75 percent of the individuals who were students or graduates of the graduate medical school outside the United States or Canada (both nationals of the United States and others) taking the examinations administered by the Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates received a passing score in the year preceding the year for which a student is seeking a loan under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Foreign Medical School Accountability Fairness Act of 2014

pursuant to this clause shall expire beginning on the first July 1 following the date of enactment of the

text.#text: The authority of a graduate medical school described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , then a student enrolled at such graduate medical school on or before the date of enactment of this Act may, notwithstanding such loss of eligibility, continue to be eligible to receive a loan under such part D while attending such graduate medical school in which the student was enrolled upon the date of enactment of this Act, subject to the student continuing to meet all applicable requirements for satisfactory academic progress, until the earliest of—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Foreign Medical School Accountability Fairness Act of 2014/s:3

text.#text: If a graduate medical school loses eligibility to participate in the loan programs under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: due to the enactment of the amendments made by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part D of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965

text.#text: withdrawal by the student from the graduate medical school;
completion of the program of study by the student at the graduate medical school; or
the fourth June 30 after such loss of eligibility.
